releases.name: Härlig var jorden
releases.description:
A remix/interpretation of a well known Scandinavian/Danish hymn called 'Härlig är jorden' by the Swedish producer Sidstar.

The idea behind this interpretation is that we have lost control of the environment, and that the world is going under. This is the funeral song of the earth.

releases.name: Greek Acid
releases.description:
What happens if you cross a 303 synth with a shepherd from Epirus?

Greek Acid: a soundtrack to centuries of migrationOn her fourth EP Greek Acid, Gavana (Anna Gavanas) retraces the Greek music she grew up with, with centuries of stories from the Greek diaspora. With her dad Manolis, Gavana has rummaged through the record shops of Athens looking for Greek traditional music like rebetiko, laikos and tsifteteli. Music inspired by migration and hybridization from east and west and speaking of crises, occupation and resistance. Greek rebetiko music was shaped among poor migrants from Asia Minor at the beginning of the 1900s. Between eastern and western scales and harmonies. Today Greek musicians are going back to the old songs about migration, hardship and love. But on this EP, Gavana has especially been inspired a shepherd’s song from Epirus with Tassos Chalkias. During all ages, shepherds from Epyrus have migrated with the changes of the seasons, regardless of national boundaries. Inspired by these sounds, and a meeting with the musician Lars Ydgren, Gavana has gone “all in.” With a 303 bassline, a sampler and a couple of analog synths she has made acid music for the dancefloor, breezing from the mountains of Epirus accompanied by crickets from Skiathos.

Dhangsha, aka Dr Das, has, in his turn, made The Greek Acid Exarchaeia remix from the streets of Athens. Dhangsha is the electronic incarnation of Aniruddha Das, aka 'Dr Das,' bassist and co-founder of Asian Dub Foundation. His remit is to explore minimalism, repetition and fragmentation in sound. While doing his Greek Acid Exarchaeia remix Dhangsha was thinking about the Athens district of Exarchaiea populated by Artists, Anarchists and Anti-fascists. This imbued the remix with a sense of militancy, energy and defiance. Dhangsha’s frequencies are always political. The remix is mastered by Ramjac at HMVS, London.

On all tracks of the EP are sounds from the clarinettist and saxophonist Lars Ydgren, whom has taken an interest in klezmer and roman music from Balkan since the 1990s. With the bands Den Flygande Bokrullen and Süperstar Orkestar he has been part of the klezmer and balkan brass influence on the Swedish live scene and released a number of records. The second record of Den Flygande Bokrullens ”20th century klezmer” was recently awarded as one of Sweden’s best folk/ world music records of all times by the music magazine Lira.

Greek Acid follows up on Gavana’s previous EPs Malaga Nights, Culture Vulture and Vicious Vibrations, which were played by Swedish National Radio’s ”Elektroniskt i P2” and covered by Johanna Paulsson, one of Sweden’s main music reviewers (Sonic #68, 2013). The track El Andaluz from Malaga Nights became a hit in Colombia (!) and the EP was listed as ”hot pick” by Sattelite Records in New York. With this new release, Gavana continues her mission as a driving force in the Swedish electronic music scene:

“Being a DJ, producer, remixer, music culture researcher as well as a label owner, Anna Gavanas is a mainstay of the Swedish electronic music scene. When producing, her perfect sense for musical intensity and mellowness guarantees a captivating listening experience.” (Gearjunkies, August 2012)

Release date November 28, release party at Club Sintetizator (at Time Bar in Hornstull/ Stockholm). The EP will be aired for the first time by Swedish National Radio/ P2 Elektroniskt

releases.name: In Tokyo
releases.description:
Sidstar returns from Tokyo with dubby chiptune hiphop.

Swedish chiptune artist Sidstar makes his music while travelling with his portable synthesizers. On his fourth record In Tokyo, Sidstar has reached the Shangri-La of videogame music: Japan. He is particularly inspired by Japanese vinyl culture, so called Kissaten cafés and bars. These are temples dedicated to listening and love for music. Moreover, Sidstar has hung out with mobsters on the back streets and alleys of the Kabuchiko neighborhood of Tokyo. They introduced him to Tan taka tan, which is shochu rice vodka with chiso-leaves. Not the least, Sidstar has been influenced by the sounds of Tokyo’s streel life and the rattling of Pachinko pinball machines.

Sidstar´s previous releases (In Andalucia, Costa del Dub and Will work for Churros) have been on the Juno Records as well as iTunes recommendation lists for electronic music, as well as being heavilyplayed by Swedish student radio.

With his new EP, Sidstar follows up on his previous chiptune records, which were inspired by synth-legends and travels to different parts of Spain.

releases.name: Retrofuturismo
releases.description:
Pufferfisk is an electronic duo from Stockholm Sweden and have previously release music on Meerkat Recordings and Clubstream.

Retrofuturismo is Pufferfisk´s album debut and is a continuation of the former EPn Bolero from 2016. The album is a futuristic 80s nostalgic trip filled with Spanish speaking robots and melodic synth lines.

Album cover by Jöran Ramhällen @ Rammhällen Design.

releases.name: Bolero (Hold Me In Your Arms Again)
releases.description: Meerkat Recordings is very proud to release the Swedish Italo and Electro duo Pufferfisk´s cover of the 1985 smash hit from Fancy Bolero (Hold Me In Your Arms Again). Pure Italo Disco 80´s bliss nostalgia!

songs.name: Bolero (Hold Me In Your Arms Again)
Bolero (Hold Me In Your Arms Again) (Instrumental)

releases.name: Introversy
releases.description:
Swedish electronica artist Aimnbreak releases the album ”Introversy” where he feasts on the warmth and comfort of analog machines.

This music is purpose built for dreaming away while looking out a train window, and for winding down after a stressful day at work. It all started in one button push a year ago when Aimnbreak lost a whole debut album he just completed. In response to this crisis situation, Aimnbreak returned to ground zero: he locked himself into his studio with his analog synths in order to find his way back.

The resulting album contrasts ambient melodies with pushy tempos, backed by bubbly 303 basslines. Introversy oscillates between ambient, acid and electro, it is neither pure acid nor pure electro. Aimnbreak entirely stakes out his own path. In contrast to his earlier compositions, driven by complex rythmic patterns, Aimnbreak has opted for soft and acid-like 303 basslines as a rythmic instrument interacting with the beats.With his new album Introversy, Aimnbreak follows up his debut-EP La Latina, which was frequently played at Swedish National Radio’s Elektroniskt i P2 and inspired by a week of mayhem in Madrid’s tripped-out party district La Latina.

The entire Introversy album is mixed with analogue tools and effects. In order to make the sounds, Aimnbreak has used semi-modular analog synths like Cwejman S1 MK2 and Macbeth Micromac-D as well as Elektron’s Analog Keys and Analog Rytm. He has also explored analog sounds with Roland Juno 106, Dave Smith’s Prophet 12 and Cyclone TT-303.

releases.name: Breaks On Fire
releases.description: WireFire releases debut album: Breaks on Fire Packed with happy acid and jungle breaks, Swedish artist WireFire is releasing his debut album Breaks on Fire on the Meerkat Recordings label. Inspired by funky acid lines, old school jungle breaks and hardcore elements, WireFire’s album blazes with 303 acid lines, happy-go-lucky melodies and irresistible breaks.

releases.name: Will work for churros
releases.description:
Sidstar on a sugar rush with new EP: 'Will Work for churros'.

Swedish artist Sidstar is releasing the ”Will Work for Churros EP”, exploring dubby depths and heights. This time he makes camp at a Churreria on the Canary Islands, accompanied by an Octatrack sampler, a Virus synth and a Gameboy with Little Sound DJ. Soaked in churros sugar and grease, Sidstar captures the craziness of island life: partying karaoke-singing Brits and pink-skinned Germans battling for sunbeds on the beach. Under the Canarian sun Sidstar overdoses on vitamin D while testing new dubby soundscapes.

With his new EP, Sidstar follows up on his two previous chiptune albums, which were inspired by Nintendo videogames while paying tribute to early synth pioneers. In contrast, the Churros EP is more up-tempo and less Lo-Fi. Simultaneously, Sidstar maintains his weakness for happy-go-lucky melodies and naive songs, oscillating between electro dub, hip hop beats and live jammed crazyness.

releases.name: Malaga Nights EP
releases.description: Sleepless nights in Malaga’s party district brings Gavana (Anna Gavanas) back to the house clubs of the 1990s, places where everything is possible and the party never ends. Malaga Nights oozes of 90s smokers like Robin S “Luv 4 Luv,” Jaydee’s “Plastic Dreams” and Mighty Dub Kats’ “Magic Carpet Ride.” On May 11th Swedish National Radio’s ”Elektroniskt i P2” airs tracks from the EP for the first time.

releases.name: Just Fuck Me EP
releases.description: Im sick of waiting for the kick ‏I want a man that knows his tricks ‏Someone that knows just where to touch ‏Such a guy I want so much ‏And Im a chick that needs to tick ‏But baby you were quick to quit ‏I got no time for all this shit ‏Just fuck me

releases.name: Costa Del Dub
releases.description: Swedish artist Sidstar is releasing Costa del Dub, his second chiptune electronica album composed during a winter on the sunny coast of Southern Spain. On December 27th winter cold, two songs from the album will air for the first time on Swedish National Radio’s show “Elektroniskt i P2.”

releases.name: Trees Fruit Vegetation
releases.description: With this EP the Bass Trolls crawl out from beneath the stone where they have been dwelling for about a decade. Bass Trolls’ shady and cave like existence has only been interrupted by short excursions to underground dub sound systems as well as pilgrimages to the UK to excavate 10 inch Steppas Dub vinyl. The Bass Trolls have also been spotted amidst urban vegetation lugging oversized record bags and portable turntables. With an armada of analog machinery and acoustic instruments the Bass Trolls have cultivated their dub sound, now pressed on this 10 inch green vinyl debut EP.

releases.name: Culture Vulture
releases.description: Gavana’s EP ”Culture Vulture” draws upon electro, hip hop and transgressive forces of dancehall. Trippy, bombastic and shameless with a cheeky twist. Two tracks on the EP are remixes from Gavana’s debut-EP ”Vicious Vibrations” released earlier this Spring: moombathon/ trap/ rave influenced versions by Swedish electronica- and drum&bass producer Aimnbreak. ”Culture Vulture” continues the explorations of Gavana’s the debut-EP, featured on Swedish National Radio (Elektroniskt i P2) and the Swedish magazines Södermalmsnytt and Sonic (#68). On both records Gavana traces dancehall influences.

releases.name: Sentiment
releases.description: Swedens finest IDM/Electronic star Ombudsman´s second album. Out on Meerkat Recordings April 18:th 2013.

releases.name: La Latina EP
releases.description: Aimnbreak makes intense and drum driven music for stressed out urban souls. Like Rhitalin for ADHD. He is the former drummer and producer that finally emerges from the background while foregrounding the drums.

releases.name: Vicious Vibrations
releases.description: With vicious vibes Gavana is launching a dancefloor explosion. On the Vicious vibrations EP she combines the positive forces of digital dancehall with influences from complex electro and techno.

releases.name: In Andalucia
releases.description: Accompanied by his tiny Teenage Engineering OP-1 synthesizer, Sidstar made his debut album in the mountains of Andalucia. Straightforward and melodic, his tracks are immediate reflections of the journey: birds chasing bugs in the pool, walks in the village of Algodonales and happy pugs stumbling about without a care in the world. Sidstar’s sound is inspired by Nintendo videogames while paying tribute to early synth pioneers. Sidstar’s productions span all the way between the naive and the grandiose while still adhering to the “less is more” principle.

releases.name: 7th Day EP
releases.description: On this EP The Nasha Experience's Nuphlo & Osmani Soundz are joined by Mumbai's Apurva and drum 'n' bass crew Delta Star [Nuphlo and Ges-E] who make their debut with the title track. The tracks on the EP have blown away the followers of BBC Asian Network. Striking a perfect balance between the subtle and the sublime the 7 th day EP innovates drum & bass and dubstep. Dexterously executed, this EP is as world class as it gets in contemporary Bass music.

releases.name: Nomads in Sound v3
releases.description: For this compilation, Swedish label Meerkat Recordings has scurried between the East and the West to sniff out the most forward pushing Dub & Dubstep artists around. Presenting our fiercest compilation so far, we have tracked down the Dub/step of tomorrow: dreamy, profound, visionary, urgent, in-your-face, transgressive and absolutely bonkers! Meerkat Recordings´ persistent search for Future Dub/step follows a winding trail from Brooklyn all the way to Bombay. Artists include Uzul (FRA), Késhava (EE), Mutamassik (ITA/US) PhOniAndFlOrE (FRA), Bass Trolls (SWE), Donna Maya (GER), Apurva (IN), Bass-Ul-Ulema Sound (BA), Hab (SWE) and Ombudsman (SWE).

releases.name: Stand Firm EP
releases.description: On the Uzul vs Bass Trolls Stand Firm EP, French dub(step) veteran Uzul (Lyon) join forces with the new Swedish dub duo Bass Trolls (Stockholm), on a dubplate released by the Swedish label Meerkat Recordings. The result is nothing short of a revolution on the dancefloor, guaranteed to move you earthquake style!

releases.name: Nomads In Sound v2​.​0
releases.description: In this compilation we demonstrate the capabilities of DJs/producers within and beyond language and politics (by any definition of the term). Our tracks thus address dimensions in electronic music culture from DJ/producer perspectives, complementary to writing about it. As specialised guides to musical worlds we make our points and tell our stories through soundscapes, weaving together auditory elements and influencing the bodies, moods and emotions of crowds. Inspired by Graham St John's recent book Technomad: Global Raving Countercultures (2009), “Nomads in Sound vol. 2” illustrates visions in electronic music cultures as collective experiences, struggles and vibes.

songs.name: My Brain Waves Transformed Into Music
If I die in this place, raise a stone and say 'he was...'

releases.name: Dub Apart EP
releases.description: A very melodic and acoustic feel Dub EP from DJplaneten.

releases.name: Nomads In Sound v1.​0
releases.description: This compilation is an experiment in sound that approaches electronic dance music (EDM) culture from a DJ/producer perspective as a complement to writing about it. Contributing artists are all EDM producers with DJ backgrounds. As artists and specialized guides to musical worlds, DJs/producers tell their stories through soundscapes, weaving together auditory elements and influencing the bodies, moods and emotions of dance crowds. Inspired by Graham St John's recent book on EDM culture 'Technomad: Global Raving Countercultures' (2009), this compilation is an attempt to illustrate visions around collective experiences, struggles and vibes.
